articles.title: Qwen Team Releases Qwen3-Coder, a Large Agentic Coding Model with Open Tooling
articles.description: Qwen Team has announced Qwen3-Coder, a new family of agentic code models designed for long-context, multi-step programming tasks. The most capable variant, Qwen3-Coder-480B-A35B-Instruct, is a Mixture-of-Experts model with a total of 480 billion parameters and 35 billion active parameters per forward pass. By Robert Krzaczyński
articles.author: Robert Krzaczyński
articles.content: Qwen Team has announced Qwen3-Coder, a new family of agentic code models designed for long-context, multi-step programming tasks. The most capable variant, Qwen3-Coder-480B-A35B-Instruct, is a Mixture-of-Experts model with a total of 480 billion parameters and 35 billion active parameters per forward pass. By Robert Krzaczyński

articles.title: Isambard-AI, the UK’s Most Powerful AI Supercomputer, Goes Live
articles.description: The University of Bristol’s Isambard-AI, powered by NVIDIA Grace Hopper Superchips, delivers 21 exaflops of AI performance, making it the fastest system in the U.K. and among the most energy-efficient globally.
articles.author: Brian Caulfield
articles.content: The University of Bristol’s Isambard-AI, powered by NVIDIA Grace Hopper Superchips, delivers 21 exaflops of AI performance, making it the fastest system in the U.K. and among the most energy-efficient globally.

articles.title: ‘Pretty revolutionary’: a Brooklyn exhibit interrogates white-dominated AI to make it more inclusive
articles.description: Stephanie Dinkins challenges the racialized AI space by highlighting Black ethos and cultural cornerstones At the Plaza at 300 Ashland Place in downtown Brooklyn, patrons mill around a large yellow shipping container with black triangles painted on its side. A nod to the flying geese quilt pattern, which may have served as a coded message for enslaved people escaping to freedom along the Underground Railroad, the design and container serve as a bridge between the past and the future of the...
articles.author: Melissa Hellmann
articles.content: Stephanie Dinkins challenges the racialized AI space by highlighting Black ethos and cultural cornerstones At the Plaza at 300 Ashland Place in downtown Brooklyn, patrons mill around a large yellow shipping container with black triangles painted on its side. articles.title: A satellite just used AI to make its own decisions in space — and NASA’s stoked
articles.description: For the first time, a satellite has used onboard AI to autonomously decide where and when to capture a scientific image — all in under 90 seconds, with no human input. The technology, called Dynamic Targeting, was tested by NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL) earlier this month. It was installed aboard a briefcase-sized satellite built and operated by UK-based startup Open Cosmos, and carried a machine learning processor developed by Dublin-based firm Ubotica. In the test, the satellite...
articles.author: Siôn Geschwindt
articles.content: For the first time, a satellite has used onboard AI to autonomously decide where and when to capture a scientific image — all in under 90 seconds, with no human input. The technology, called Dynamic Targeting, was tested by NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL) earlier this month. It was installed aboard a briefcase-sized satellite built and operated by UK-based startup Open Cosmos, and carried a machine learning processor developed by Dublin-based firm Ubotica. articles.title: AI data-suckers would have to ask permission first under new bill
articles.description: If it passes, the law would redefine the boundaries of fair use A bipartisan pair of US Senators introduced a bill this week that would protect copyrighted content from being used for AI training without the owner's permission. Content creators from large media companies to individual bloggers could effectively block Google, Meta, OpenAI, Anthropic, and others from appropriating their work.…
articles.author: Brandon Vigliarolo
articles.content: If it passes, the law would redefine the boundaries of fair use A bipartisan pair of US Senators introduced a bill this week that would protect copyrighted content from being used for AI training without the owner's permission. articles.title: AI and the 2025 SIEM landscape: A guide for SOC leaders
articles.description: Security teams often find themselves having to put out the immediate fires in front of them, but this comes at the expense of implementing a more methodical risk reduction strategy. Attack surfaces are expanding, and new risks emerge with new tech. Modern security operations center (SOC) teams are drowning in alerts, stretched thin by talent shortages, and racing to stay ahead of increasingly sophisticated adversaries.Security information and event management (SIEM) platforms are instrumental...
articles.author: Elastic Security Team
articles.content: Security teams often find themselves having to put out the immediate fires in front of them, but this comes at the expense of implementing a more methodical risk reduction strategy. Attack surfaces are expanding, and new risks emerge with new tech. Modern security operations center (SOC) teams are drowning in alerts, stretched thin by talent shortages, and racing to stay ahead of increasingly sophisticated adversaries.Security information and event management (SIEM) platforms are instrumental...

articles.title: AI Is Quietly Rewriting Work—Here’s What You Need to Know
articles.description: Compound Interest: AI’s Invisible Impact on Productivity and Jobs I’ve learned to tune out the “Are we there yet?” chorus that follows every AI model release. articles.title: NIH study links particulate air pollution to increased mutations in lung cancers among nonsmokers
articles.description: Whole-genome sequencing study found air pollution to cause more cancer-related changes than secondhand smoke.
articles.content: Whole-genome sequencing study found air pollution to cause more cancer-related changes than secondhand smoke.
